Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2014 06:04PM Bootsygirl wrote: thanks so much Bessie and Melissa. I really appreciate you taking the time to respond. I am doing my best to just "keep on livin' and lovin' my kiddos" to keep my mind off everything until my appt. on the 27th. Thank you again!
Posts.Title: Afraid I have waited too long... Bootsygirl Bootsygirl

Posts.Content: Bootsygirl wrote: I am an optimist by nature, but I have a strong feeling I have breast cancer.... And that I have (by my own fault through ignorance first and denial second) waited too long to find out. Here is the timeline. I am 37, 3 kids 3,4 and 7 and no history of breast cancer in my family... Maybe that is why I am so naive. Last December- had a weird bee sting feeling in right breast- aware of it, but only had it once so didn't think much of it.  January- horribly sore breasts around period- so bad I took a pregnancy test b/c that was always my first pregnancy sign. Negative. Breasts felt better after period ( I had never had cyclical breast pain prior to last January). Right breast worse than left. Feb. Annual OBGYN appt. mention breast pain- dr. Says hormonal, I should be lucky this is the first I have had it. Does breast exam- feels nothing abnormal. I believe her.  March-August- sporadic "bee sting/shooting pain" in right breast as well as horrible hormonal pain before period. Also start experiencing awful cystic acne. Dermatologist puts me on spironolactone- I can only take it 2 months because of even worse breast pain and absent periods. Not a fan of how I was feeling so decided to deal with acne. End of August/ Sept.- start  having weird shoulder pain and knot in right shoulder. Chalk it up to working out/ muscle strain. Sometimes travels down arm (convince self of carpal tunnel). Start googling. "BC doesn't hurt"- shew!!!  "In fact, BC does hurt!"- the beginning of panic and anxiety. Stop googling. October- freaked out that pain in right breast persists and  shoulder and sometimes rib cage so go back to OB/GYN. She feels nothing abnormal except very fibrous tissue and says let's send you for a baseline- it's probably just hormones and fibrous tissue though. (Why just one achy breast though?)  November- mammogram normal. What I think will make all pain and anxiety magically disappear does not. December- call OB/GYN again and explain still having pain despite normal mammo, now what? Takes me off caffeine and adds Vitamin E. In December, I still have sore right shoulder, sore spot on back, occasional right ribcage/sternum pain and still very aware of achy right breast. Add "weird vision" to the list- not sure if related... But since I'm at it....  January- I have an appt. with a breast specialist on the 27th finally. I have had two panic attacks (the only 2 of my life) in the past month fretting over a. Not only the possibility of having BC but mostly, because this has been "on the radar" for almost 13 months now and what if I have truly waited too long to have a good chance at an early diagnosis? What if all of these other pains (right ribcage twinging as I type) are progression? I too know I could be far off, but as I said... Sometimes you just have a feeling. I have a feeling.  I am posting because these boards have already been a tremendous wealth of information and well... I guess since the ONLY person I have talked to about this is my hubby and he thinks I am borderline nuts about it... After a year, I needed to get it out there.  So, thank you if you are reading. ❤️ God bless each and every one of you on your journeys! You are truly inspirational.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Afraid I have waited too long... Bootsygirl Bootsygirl

Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2014 10:24AM Bootsygirl wrote: Shelle- I will for sure say a prayer for you and all who are waiting.... Anxiety from fear of the unknown is the WORST. Good Luck and let is know what you find out!!!
